title: How to Map Your Walk at MapMyWalk

steps.headline: Create an account if you haven't already.
steps.description: You can sign in with your Facebook account if you like.

steps.headline: Click on Create Route.
steps.description: This will load up tools that you need to create your map.

steps.headline: Take a second to get your bearings.
steps.description: If you have put your location in your profile, you should be at your town.

steps.headline: Hover over where you will start your walk.
steps.description: It could be at home or maybe you drove to a park, or anything else. Click there.

steps.headline: Click at a little bit away in the direction that you went.
steps.description: It doesn't have to be at every single corner. The map maker will stick with main roads unless you indicate otherwise.

steps.headline: Avoid fretting if you find your path went wrong.
steps.description: Click Undo and backtrack to where it is correct.

steps.headline: Continue making your map, turn by turn.
steps.description: If you need to, click and hold the left mouse down to move the screen (location) around.

steps.headline: Fill out the information on the left.
steps.description: Try to give each walk an identifying name so you know it for future reference.

steps.headline: Log it as a workout.
steps.description: Fill out the information under there so you can count it as a workout.

steps.headline: Click on Save.
steps.description: That is on the far upper right hand corner.

text: Create an account if you haven't already. You can sign in with your Facebook account if you like. Click on Create Route. This will load up tools that you need to create your map. Take a second to get your bearings. If you have put your location in your profile, you should be at your town. Hover over where you will start your walk. It could be at home or maybe you drove to a park, or anything else. Click there. Click at a little bit away in the direction that you went. It doesn't have to be at every single corner. The map maker will stick with main roads unless you indicate otherwise. Avoid fretting if you find your path went wrong. Click Undo and backtrack to where it is correct. Continue making your map, turn by turn. If you need to, click and hold the left mouse down to move the screen (location) around. Fill out the information on the left. Try to give each walk an identifying name so you know it for future reference. Log it as a workout. Fill out the information under there so you can count it as a workout. Click on Save. That is on the far upper right hand corner.

Click on Create Route.
This will load up tools that you need to create your map.
Take a second to get your bearings.
If you have put your location in your profile, you should be at your town.
Hover over where you will start your walk.
It could be at home or maybe you drove to a park, or anything else.
Click there.
Click at a little bit away in the direction that you went.
It doesn't have to be at every single corner.
The map maker will stick with main roads unless you indicate otherwise.
Avoid fretting if you find your path went wrong.
Click Undo and backtrack to where it is correct.
Continue making your map, turn by turn.
If you need to, click and hold the left mouse down to move the screen (location) around.
Fill out the information on the left.
Try to give each walk an identifying name so you know it for future reference.
Log it as a workout.
Fill out the information under there so you can count it as a workout.
Click on Save.
That is on the far upper right hand corner.
